title: Automatic Video Tagging with Amazon Rekognition
description: Create an event-driven workflow to automatically tag stored video using Amazon Rekognition, AWS Lambda, and Amazon DynamoDB.

introBox.headline: How it works
text: This sample project demonstrates how to deliver an event-driven architecture to label stored video and hold within Amazon DynamoDB.

This pattern allows you to store video files in an Amazon S3 bucket, which triggers the workflow. Upon an object being created in the S3 bucket, a Lambda function is invoked, which initiates Amazon Rekognition's StartLabelDetection function. The function runs in the background and upon completion, publishes a notification to our SNS Topic. The topic is subscibed to by an AWS Lambda function (with SQS queue). This second Lambda Function invokes the GetLabelDetection, retrieving the video's detected metadata and labels, and then finally stores in our DynamoDB table.
This pattern deploys one S3 bucket, 2 Lambda Functions, 1 SNS, 1 SQS, and 1 DynamoDB Table.
See the GitHub repo for detailed testing instructions.
